intro: Hieracium contii, commonly known as the Conti's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny exposures. Its yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer, are surrounded by a ring of pale green to white ray florets. Hieracium contii is often found in meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cooler, moist environments.
